intro: Ophiorrhiza subserrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal sandy soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to withstand salt spray and sandy conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
